intro: Scurrula praelonga, commonly known as the long-stalked scurrula, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. The flowers are yellow with purple markings, appearing in late summer to early autumn.
